title: 110_hr1733
content: Appropriations Transparency Act of 2007 - Allows a point of order to be made by any Member in the House of Representatives or the Senate against consideration of a conference report that includes any earmark or tax earmark not committed to conference by either chamber. Defines tax earmark as any revenue-losing provision that provides a federal tax deduction, credit, exclusion, or preference to only one beneficiary under the Internal Revenue Code in any year for which the provision is in effect.
